The jury in the rape trial of former NRL star Jarryd Hayne has been urged to keep deliberating after announcing it has been unable to reach a unanimous verdict.

articles.title: Warriors' request to train at home denied as club makes call to start NRL season in Australia - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: Warriors' application for Aussie-based players to train in managed isolation, similar to the Wallabies, knocked back as wait continues for return to Mt Smart.
articles.content: Warriors chief executive Cameron George has revealed the Government declined the club's request to have their Australian-based players train in managed isolation in New Zealand as he announced their … [+4688 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: England's T20 international side sends messages to the team during game with coded 'signals' from the balcony - ABC News
articles.description: England's cricket team uses cards with letters and numbers on them to send signals to the team while fielding in a T20 international
articles.content:
Former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan has spoken out against a decision by the team to send coded information using signals during a T20 international against South Africa.
